channel.title: [PI] Creating Godwars
channel.description:
Hiya guys, I'm basically creating a new godwars as the one on my source is completely useless and doesn't work. So far I have created an area for the hobgoblins (ID = 122) and spawned them. What I am looking for help with:
- Making a killcount - Making you unable to use the portal to get to a monster unless you have 20 kills - Make the portal have 4 options (Bandos, zamorak, saradomin and armadyl)
If anyone could help it would be greatly appreciated! I have TeamViewer so that is always an option. Thanks!

item.title: [PI] Creating Godwars
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“A New LIght, post:14, topic:420061”][quote author=ProximityPlus link=topic=522620.msg3801066#msg3801066 date=1320014350]

I don’t use teamview/msn/etc sorry.

Oh no worries im an absolute moron XD It wasn’t working because on my server i am an admin and for some reason admins can’t get drops or any other points :S Any fix for that by any chance? XD
[/quote]um maybe npcdrops.java ? Not entirely sure if you don’t see a playerRight limit there try itemhandler.java

only two places that comes to mind.[/quote]
My mistake…

c.sendMessage("You currently have" + c.pointTypes + " Kill Count.");

to this…

c.sendMessage("You currently have" + c.killCount + " Kill Count.");

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Creating Godwars
item.dc:creator: @ProximityPlus ProximityPlus
item.description:
@ProximityPlus wrote:

[quote=“A New LIght, post:10, topic:420061”]Yeah I was just using pointType as an example symbol sorry for not saying that. [hr]

Did you add that message right under the npchandler part where you tell which npc gives those points? It should look like this( not converted correctly just a rough draft)

c.pointType += 0 c.sendMessage("blahblahblah");[/quote]

Yehh I’ve done it perfectly :S I don’t see whats going wrong! Could you possibly help through msn?

Read full topic

[/quote]

simple enough

right below the npchandler part where you add the point to the npchandler you would do something like this(this is probably wrong format but whatever xD)

it would be something similar to this

programming, irc, cars

That should get you most of what you are looking for.
[/quote]

Okay that’s brilliant! But one question, how do I make it so it so that when the npc is killed, it comes up in the chatbox saying “Your killcount is 1”?[/quote]

simple enough

right below the npchandler part where you add the point to the npchandler you would do something like this(this is probably wrong format but whatever xD)

it would be something similar to this

c.sendMessage("You currently have" + c.pointTypes + " Kill Count.");

item.title: [PI] Creating Godwars
item.dc:creator: @ProximityPlus ProximityPlus
item.description:
@ProximityPlus wrote:

[quote=“A New LIght, post:2, topic:420061”]Well first off, you have to make a point system of some kind. I won’t go into the specifics on how to make the system itself as that can be googled easily. To make an npc specifically give points you would do something like this(in PI npchandler)

if (npcs[i].npcType == NPCID) { c.pointType += 1; }

now of course a godwars area is going to have more than one monster but this was just a general idea. I am not spoon feeding you.

For the kc you want to make a case for it that states you need >= 20 more of that point to enter. so something like this just roughly drawn

hint: make sure to make an int for the point system and make sure to add to your character list.[/quote]

That’s very useful thanks for the little starter! I’d ++ you if i could… xD
More help would still be appreciated though (I am extremely new to this)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Creating Godwars
item.dc:creator: @A_New_LIght A New LIght
item.description:
@A_New_LIght wrote:

Well first off, you have to make a point system of some kind. I won’t go into the specifics on how to make the system itself as that can be googled easily. To make an npc specifically give points you would do something like this(in PI npchandler)

if (npcs[i].npcType == NPCID) { c.pointType += 1; }

now of course a godwars area is going to have more than one monster but this was just a general idea. I am not spoon feeding you.

For the kc you want to make a case for it that states you need >= 20 more of that point to enter. so something like this just roughly drawn

hint: make sure to make an int for the point system and make sure to add to your character list.

Read full topic
